subtitleNullable: Transforming Lives, Shaping the Future: Millennium Development Goals (MDGs)
descriptionNullable:
Context

The Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) dataset is a collection of indicators drawn from the World Development Indicators, reorganized according to the goals and targets of the Millennium Development Goals. The dataset covers the period from 1990 to 2014 and provides insights into various aspects of global development.

Content

The Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) dataset includes six CSV files that provide valuable information related to global development. The files cover the period from 1990 to 2014 and contain data, indicators, and details about countries, series, and footnotes. By analyzing this dataset, researchers and data analysts can gain insights into various aspects of development progress worldwide.

Features

  • File: MDG_Country-Series.csv
    • CountryCode: Country code associated with the series (object)
    • SeriesCode: Code representing a specific series (object)
    • DESCRIPTION: Description of the series (object)
    • Unnamed: 3: Unnamed column (object)
  • File: MDG_Country.csv
    • Country Code: Code representing a specific country (object)
    • Short Name: Short name of the country (object)
    • Table Name: Name of the table (object)
    • Long Name: Full name of the country (object)
    • Region: Geographic region of the country (object)
    • Income Group: Income group classification of the country (object)
    • ...
  • File: MDG_Data.csv
    • Country Name: Name of the country (object)
    • Country Code: Code representing a specific country (object)
    • Indicator Name: Name of the indicator (object)
    • Indicator Code: Code representing a specific indicator (object)
    • 1990 to 2016: Values representing the indicator for each year (object)
  • File: MDG_FootNote.csv
    • CountryCode: Country code associated with the series (object)
    • SeriesCode: Code representing a specific series (object)
    • Year: Year of the footnote (object)
    • DESCRIPTION: Description of the footnote (object)
    • Unnamed: 4: Unnamed column (object)
  • File: MDG_Series-Time.csv
    • SeriesCode: Code representing a specific series (object)
    • Year: Year of the series (object)
    • DESCRIPTION: Description of the series (object)
    • Unnamed: 3: Unnamed column (object)
  • File: MDG_Series.csv
    • Series Code: Code representing a specific series (object)
    • Topic: Topic/category of the series (object)
    • Indicator Name: Name of the indicator (object)
    • Short definition: Short definition of the indicator (object)
    • Long definition: Detailed definition of the indicator (object)
    • Unit of measure: Unit of measurement for the indicator (object)
    • Periodicity: Frequency of data collection for the indicator (object)
    • ...

Inspiration (Use Cases)

  • Identifying trends and patterns: Analyze the data to identify trends and patterns in the progress of the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) over the years. Gain insights into the areas where progress has been made and where more efforts are needed.
  • Evaluating the impact of policies and interventions: Assess the effectiveness of policies and interventions implemented to achieve the MDGs by examining the corresponding indicators and their changes over time. Understand the influence of various factors on the outcomes.
  • Comparative analysis: Conduct comparative analysis across countries, regions, or income groups to understand the variations in progress and identify successful strategies and best practices for achieving the MDGs.
  • Monitoring and reporting: Use the dataset to monitor the progress of the MDGs and generate reports for tracking the achievement of specific goals and targets. Keep stakeholders informed about the status of different indicators and areas requiring attention.
  • Research and academic studies: Utilize the comprehensive dataset to conduct research and academic studies on various aspects related to the MDGs. Explore correlations, causal relationships, and interdependencies among different indicators to contribute to the field of development studies.
  • Evidence-based decision-making: Empower policymakers, development practitioners, and organizations with data-driven insights to support evidence-based decision-making. Inform the design and implementation of strategies and interventions aimed at advancing the MDGs.

Acknowledgement: I would like to thank the World Bank for providing the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) dataset through their World Development Indicators. I acknowledge the World Bank's efforts in collecting, organizing, and making this valuable dataset publicly available for research, analysis, and informed decision-making. https://data.world/worldbank/
title: Millennium Development Goals (MDGs 1990 - 2014)
